pli-tv-bu-vb-pc50:0.2: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc50:0.3: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc50:1.1: On one occasion when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc50:1.2: the monks from the group of six were staying with the army for two or three nights. They went to see battles, troop reviews, the massing of the army, and troop inspections.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc50:1.3: One of the monks who went to a battle was even struck by an arrow.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc50:1.5: “We hope you had a good battle, Venerable. How many targets did you hit?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc50:1.6: And because they teased him, he felt humiliated.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc50:1.7: People complained and criticized those monks,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc50:1.8: “How can the Sakyan ascetics go to see a battle?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc50:1.9: It’s our misfortune that we must go to battles for the sake of our livelihood and because of our wives and children.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc50:1.10: The monks heard the complaints of those people,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc50:1.11: and the monks of few desires complained and criticized those monks,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc50:1.12: “How can the monks from the group of six go to see a battle?” …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc50:1.13: “Is it true, monks, that you did this?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc50:1.16: “… Foolish men, how can you go to see a battle?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc50:1.17: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc50:1.18: And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc50:1.19.1: ‘If a monk who is staying with an army for two or three nights goes to a battle, a troop review, a massing of the army, or a troop inspection, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc50:2.1.1: If a monk who is staying with an army for two or three nights:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc50:2.1.2: he is staying for two or for three nights.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc50:2.1.6: so many elephants, so many horses, so many chariots, so much infantry.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc50:2.1.8: the elephants should set out from here; the horses should set out from here; the chariots should set out from here; the infantry should set out from here.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc50:2.1.10: elephant troops, horse troops, chariot troops, infantry troops.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc50:2.1.11: The smallest unit of elephants is three elephants; the smallest unit of horses is three horses; the smallest unit of chariots is three chariots; the smallest unit of infantry is four men with arrows in hand.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc50:2.1.12.1: If he is on his way to see it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc50:2.1.13: Wherever he stands to see it, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc50:2.1.14: Every time he moves outside of the range of sight and then sees it again, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc50:2.1.15: If he is on his way to see one division of a fourfold army, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc50:2.1.16: Wherever he stands to see it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc50:2.1.17: Every time he moves outside of the range of sight and then sees it again, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc50:2.2.2: if he sees it while standing in the monastery;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc50:2.2.3: if the army comes to where the monk is standing, sitting, or lying down, and he then sees fighting;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc50:2.2.4: if he sees it while walking in the opposite direction;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc50:2.2.5: if he goes because there is something to be done, and he then sees it;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc50:2.2.8: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc50:2.2.9: The tenth rule, the training rule on battles, is finished.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc50:2.2.10: The fifth sub-chapter on naked ascetics is finished.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc50:2.2.15: Army, and struck: those are the ten.
